intro: Maranthes glabra, commonly known as the smooth maranthes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly found in countries like Mexico and Central America. The plant features upright, grass-like foliage with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are smooth to the touch. Its flowers are small and clustered in spike-like inflorescences, typically displaying shades of white, pink, or red. Maranthes glabra thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
